Label: Description
Value: We use an anonymized snapshot of all active Facebook users and their friendship networks to measure the intensity of connectedness between locations. The Social Connectedness Index (SCI) quantifies the relative probability that two individuals from different geographies are Facebook friends, providing a large-scale measure of social ties across regions.  This release updates the SCI with substantially expanded global coverage and finer geographic resolution, including new subnational units across 178 countries. Details on the underlying data and index construction are provided in the “The Social Connectedness Index.pdf.” A companion GitHub repository, available at [https://github.com/social-connectedness-index/social-connectedness-index], provides code to generate maps from the SCI with minimal setup.

Label: Contributor
Value: AI and Data for Good at Meta

Label: Define Methodology
Value:
We use an anonymized snapshot of all active Facebook users and their friendship networks to measure the intensity of connectedness between locations. The Social Connectedness Index (SCI) is a measure of the social connectedness between different geographies. Specifically, it measures the relative probability that two individuals across two locations are friends with each other on Facebook.

This release updates the SCI with substantially expanded global coverage and finer geographic resolution, including new subnational units across 178 countries. Details on the underlying data and index construction are provided in the “The Social Connectedness Index.pdf.”

Label: Caveats/Comments
Value: We do not provide older versions of the Social Connectedness Index as we do not recommend it being interpreted as a time series. The methodology for constructing SCI has changed over time (and continues to improve), and we do not backfill for previous dates.

Label: Description
Value: Country-to-country SCI pairs. Each row represents a unique country–country pair, identified by ISO2 codes.

Label: Description
Value: Subnational SCI pairs at GADM administrative level 1 (e.g., states/provinces). Built using Database of Global Administrative Areas (GADM, version 4.1). Each row represents a region–region pair within GADM level 1.

Label: Description
Value: Subnational SCI pairs at GADM administrative level 2 (e.g., counties/districts). Built using Database of Global Administrative Areas (GADM, version 4.1). Due to size, data is split into 12 shards, where each shard contains regions up to the last ISO2 country code in that shard (alphabetically).

Label: Description
Value: Subnational SCI pairs at geoBoundaries ADM1 level. Built using the geoBoundaries Global Database of Political Administrative Boundaries.

Label: Description
Value: Subnational SCI pairs at geoBoundaries ADM2 level. Built using the geoBoundaries Global Database of Political Administrative Boundaries. Split into 12 shards, ordered alphabetically by ISO2 country code, with shard names indicating the last country included.

Label: Description
Value: European subnational SCI pairs based on NUTS 2024 regions. Includes all NUTS levels (1, 2, 3). Contains three files for the three NUTS levels.

Label: Description
Value: US county-level SCI pairs. Each row represents a county-to-county pair. Counties are denoted by their 5-digit FIPS code.

Label: Description
Value: US ZIP Code Tabulation Area (ZCTA) SCI pairs. Split into 10 shards, where shard number n contains all ZIP codes whose starting digit is n.

Label: Description
Value: SCI between countries and subnational regions at various granularities. Contains all region types in the dataset (GADM 1/2, geoBoundaries ADM 1/2, NUTS 1/2/3, US counties, ZCTA).
